dialogues.text: The cat says meow! The pig says oink! Gary smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cow says moo! The cow says moo! The cow says moo! Evidently, Jaden loves the cow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog says, nine. Nine. Nine. Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary looks back.     Did he just hear that? The phone RINGS. 159

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary answers it on the third ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the parole system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Two trains run through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music STRIKES. We see a sudden change in Gary's expressio He nearly drops the phone. Forcing himself not to panic, he pushes the button for speakerphone. He wants to make sure he's hearing it right

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine.    Nine. Nine. Nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary backs away from the phone like it might sprout legs jump on him. Suddenly, he backs into SOMEONE ELSE. He spins around, startled. He only catches a glimpse of T MAN -- same height, same build, same everything. The Man gone in half an instant, vanished into thin air. Gary bolts for the door. Reaching the foyer, Gary steps on a

dialogues.speaker: RAT TRAP,
dialogues.text: which SNAPS down on his toes. He SCREAMS, pulling it off. He looks around to find all eight traps are now on the ma floor, rather than the second-floor walkway. Limping, he hops out the door.     We stay behind, lookin through the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEADLIGHTS FLARE as cars travel down Miracle Mile, bringi us to a Metro Bus stop -- a semi-enclosed bench with back signage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The far side of the shelter has a one-sheet for Crime Lab ("This fall, Mondays are murder.") The bench side is a pr poster for a show called Knowing. ("Some fates are chosen for you.") It's here we find Gary taking a seat, gingerly checking h toes where the rat trap snapped. He's hobbled his way her from the house, which is probably a block away. There's only a little blood, but his toes really hurt. Over Gary's shoulder, we see a blonde 8-year old girl (Noelle) watching him with concern. She BANGS on the shel to get his attention. Gary nearly jumps out of his skin. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!   You scared the shit out of... She signs "What's wrong?" GARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) What? NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signed, subtitled) You're hurt. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't speak that.   Sorry.   I don't... She points to his toes.   Getting what she must mean... GARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.    I'll be fine. Looking around, he realizes that the little girl is out h by herself. GARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are your parents? She looks at him oddly, not really getting the question. GARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom, your dad. Where are they? NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signed, subtitled) Mom is at the car. Where you left her. Again, Gary has no idea what she's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (signed, subtitled) You're lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you need to go back, okay? You shouldn't be out here. It's not safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noelle glances to her left. We hear BWOOP BWOOP as a police cruiser pulls over to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go to a WIDER ANGLE as TWO OFFICERS get out of the car Gary looks back. Noelle is gone, though there's really nowhere she could h disappeared. Putting on his best face for the police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening, officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handcuffed, Gary is placed in back.     He's reserving th to remain silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, the idea of house arrest is you stay inside your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same parole officer from earlier attaches a black ank to Gary's left leg. We see that Gary's left foot also features bandaged toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it like an electronic leash. Basically, if you ever go more than 100 feet from the base station...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to an electronic device by the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the cops come, they throw your ass in jail. If you ever try to take it off, the cops come and throw your ass in jail. And if they ever detect drugs or alcohol in your system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the cops come and throw my ass in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I kick your ass. Then the cops come and throw your ass in jail. The parole officer smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I still have to answer the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll be doing that from now on. I'm moving into the guest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a babysitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite all evidence to the contrary. Don't worry, I'm a cool roomie. Who do you think taught Affleck how to gamble? The parole officer hits a test button on the anklet, whic lets out a PIERCING ALARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's never hear that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret walks heel-to-toe, counting her steps.
With a piece of chalk, she draws a line on the concrete. looks back to Gary, who's waiting by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold! The edge of your world. In the world. (jumps over the line)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the world. In the world. Out of the world. Look at me, I'm dancin'! She starts doing the running man over the line.   Even Ga dark mood is broken. 162

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret and Gary roast marshmallows over the propane gri to make s'mores. They're giggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the guy was like, "Do you know fencing?" And I say, of course. That's what it says on my headshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always.   So he says, "Foil or epi?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EpГ©e.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, I'm about equal in both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he tosses me this fucking Conan sword and goes after me. I'm just swinging, trying to stay alive. But I end up cutting his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut his ear off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little. But I got the job. Margaret is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. You were in Pirates of the Caribbean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. No. Not the movie, the ride. I was like, "Gar! Keep both hands inside the boat!" Margaret laughs so hard she coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for bed, Margaret leans out the guest bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, fuckface. Gary looks out his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, you filthy whore. Both doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredible. 166

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret and Gary sip their morning beverages, looking at something spectacular in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Whenever I see them, and I always feel like, damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was born at the wrong time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We REVERSE to see the object of their awe: a giant inflatable jump-o-rama in the shape of a castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS: Gary and Margaret jump with all their migh bouncing off the walls, SCREAMING all the time. When both finally collapse, it becomes strangely tranquil They're safe inside an inflatable paradise. Gary scoots over beside Margaret.     She puts her head o arms. It's nice. Prelap:   A doorbell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary opens the door to find Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the warden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the little missus. She walks past him, into the house. 169

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah crosses to the couch, picking up the baby monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Jaden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boring. We haven't had nearly the grand old time you two have been having. There's an edge to her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I don't want to meddle in your affairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My affairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone needs affection.    I get it. She's headed back for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.    Are you seriously jealous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opposite. I just want to protect her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From you. Look at you. You date models. Actresses. Tennis players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a scale of one to ten, you belong with the Nines. We both know you won't settle for less. With that, she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary is trying to load dishes into the dishwasher, but ha hard time getting one bowl to fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are "the Nines?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He looks over.    Margaret holds up the orange sticky not the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Look for the Nines."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't write it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She puts it back down.    But she doesn't believe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All-ee-all-ee-all-come-free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I thought you were...forget it. Done.    Sorry. 171

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the far edge of the property, Margaret and Gary play backgammon. Their mood is significantly more subdued. Margaret answers her RINGING cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yhello? Hi. What?! (to Gary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to take this. He nods.   Margaret starts walking back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who thought it was a good idea letting Courtney into a pottery shop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left alone, Gary rolls the dice idly. He gets a 4 and a 5 Rolls again. 4,5. 3,6. 4,5. 3,6. 3,6. 3,6. 4,5. He keeps rolling, the wheels in his head starting to turn 172

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is looking in through the living room windows, tryi to spot Gary. Giving up, she turns back to the main steps only to find...

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET,
dialogues.text: who doesn't look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you are. And if you come near him again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret lets that go unanswered.   There's obviously something big we're not privy to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, M...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's forgotten Margaret's name -- if she ever knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, what's he calling you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that. "Margaret."   Classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you just leave him alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone? He's an actor. If nobody's watching him, he doesn't really exist. (approaching) And for the record, I'm not the one deceiving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to figure it out eventually. And when he does, who do you think he's gonna blame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah lets her warning land, then walks past Margaret, heading back down the stairs. REVEAL Gary watching through the hole in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary heard the whole conversation.   Or at least enough o to be deeply freaked out. 173

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret leans out her doorway:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, ratface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary sits in one of the upholstered chairs, staring at hi still-made bed. It's impossible to know what he's thinkin but the wheels are turning. 176

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary opens the newspaper to a page at random.   He starts circling things with a red Sharpie. MACRO CLOSE UP.    His pen circles the number nine every it appears. As he flips the page, he spots Sarah looking in through t rounded trellis, just a few feet away. She's holding her newspaper, still in the wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for the psychotic episode. I'll blame it on hormones. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? You look a little Beautiful Mind-ish. He almost deflects it, but decides to trust her: GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times should the number nine come up? Probablistically? SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probablistically? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) You know what I mean. SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time out of ten. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about every time? He hands her the paper through the bars. GARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they only show up when you look for them. Looking for them changes things. Trying to find an explanation... SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of these are prices. There's going to be a lot of nines when... GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something wrong with the world. Sarah looks up slowly. She smiles for an uncomfortably lo beat. She's stalling, thinking. SARAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an eyelash on your... here... She steps forward, and motions for him to lean closer to bars. Brushing off the non-existent eyelash, she WHISPERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you out of here.    But you have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET
dialogues.text: enters, carrying her tea. She sees Gary by himself, leani near the bars of the trellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peachy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peachy's good. I like peaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see that Sarah is flush back against the wall, out of Margaret's line of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She turns and heads back into the house.    Once she's ou earshot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to trust me. 177

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a white plastic device mounted in the corner of room, about ten feet up. It might be a smoke detector. Gary stares up at it, intently.    He steps forward. A little red light flicks on inside the unit. After a few seconds it turns off. It's some sort of motion detector. Gary tests it again, trying to move his arm slowly enough that the light never engages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margaret enters, carrying two mugs.   She watches him war MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the Nines. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nines? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nines. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of hard to start there... GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try. And don't tell me I'm imagining it. They're showing up everywhere, and I want to know why. Trying to formulate the simplest truthful explanation: MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best guess? They're your subconscious trying to remind you who you are. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Nine? MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It doesn't make a lot of sense of out context. (offering) Coffee? He takes the mug, then reconsiders.   Maybe it's laced wi something. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you drink coffee?   You're always drinking tea. Frustrated, she takes his coffee back and drinks it. She' really like to drink the whole thing to prove her point, it's just too hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy? She gestures for him to sit down.     Reluctantly, he doe sits across from him. MARGARET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to understand this yet, but we've known each other for like 25 years. One day when I was 12, you called me out of the blue. And we've been talking ever since. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone. Usually. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never met you before I came here. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, Gary, never met me. But you're not always... (lacking the words) I can understand why you're a little confused. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'm a lot confused. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theories? GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all a dream. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a coma. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) No. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm dead. This is Hell, or Purgatorium or something. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, a purgatorium is where Romans vomited. But no. This is as real as anything can be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? She sits forward in her chair.    By instinct, he sits ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is what it is. But you're not who you think you are. 178

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary gets up, headed for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, no!   Please, Gary, don't. But he's already outside. 180

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's walking towards the blue chalk perimeter line, heade for Sarah's house. Leaves fall lazily from the trees, counter-point to the tension. Margaret calls out from the arched windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're doing. She's almost at tears.   He stops at the edge of the chal line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if I cross this line? The tear in her eye falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But it's not good. He very deliberately steps over the line. We hear a thin BEEPING from the house-arrest anklet. He shoots her a loo to say, is that all there is? But the BEEPING grows louder, deeper. It starts to come f all sides, booming, a nuclear-meltdown/self-destruct-sequ activated DRONE. Gary suddenly realizes something very, very terrible is a to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. The world ignites in white-hot atomic flames. We see the blinding glare erupt behind Margaret, illumina through her skin, right to the bone. The same flash catches a leaf in mid-air, sizzling throug like an etched x-ray. As the light hits Gary, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: READER NOTE: Part 2 is a half-hour episode of a Project Greenlight-style documentary series called "Behind the Screen," which tracks the progress of a one-hour TV drama pilot from conception through delivery. In keeping with the genre, it's very fast and cutty. INTERVIEW sequences are done to an off- camera interviewer. Some scenes are unscripted. The gist of these scenes is summarized in italics.

dialogues.speaker: TITLES OVER
dialogues.text: Part Two:

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED TITLES
dialogues.text: We RUSH IN on a television set, which spins around reveal a blinding constellation of pixels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Previously, on "Behind the Screen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAVIN TAYLOR (30) walks to a meeting, with his laptop bag over his shoulder. He has a tidy, Banana Republic sensibility and an easy smile that belies his manic sched

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin Taylor's one of the best TV writers out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cluttered and corporate, with stacks of scripts and a few touches of arbitrary quirk. SUSAN HOWARD (35) and Gavin k hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every network would kill to work with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Knowing" is a one-hour drama about a woman whose husband disappears. She starts to believe that her daughter is the key to a dark conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin pitches his show to the NETWORK BOSSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically, it's like "Rosemary's Toddler." 206

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impromptu INTERVIEW.    Gavin is beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sold it in the room. 207

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin leans into the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me Roger liked the script. 208

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is on her speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shooting a pilot. 209

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin has coffee with actress MELISSA McCARTHY (34), his friend. He's pitching her the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa McCarthy is my first and only choice for the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.     I'll do it. 210

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EPK-style INTERVIEW, on the set of the pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin and I have been friends for forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa hangs out with her "Gilmore Girls" CAST and CREW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really hard to leave a show like "Gilmore Girls," but I really believe in Gavin. 212

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin, Susan and a LINE PRODUCER go over the figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way we can afford to shoot the pilot is in Canada. 213

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin stacks up clothes on his bed, preparing to pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really hard to think about leaving for six weeks. 214

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin YELLS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action! A STEADICAM follows Melissa as she gets out the passenger door of a Toyota Prius, an alarmed look on her face. 215

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRIVER holds up a sign for "TAYLOR." Gavin approaches, waves to him. He has a laptop bag over his shoulder. TITLES identify him as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin Taylor Creator / Showrunner 218

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin unlocks the door, entering from the driveway. He's hauling a massive wheeled duffle bag. (Note: This is the same house from Part One.) We hear the CLATTER of toenails on hardwood floors.   Gav kneels down to greet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puggies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin's PUGS pounce all over him. 219

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin is on the cordless phone, talking with a friend as sorts through massive piles of mail. On his left wrist, we notice the same green string bracel Gary wore in Part One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird being back. It doesn't feel like my house anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin sits at the piano, pecking out a haunting melody he been fiddling with. He grabs a red diskette and a Sharpie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this stage, you have the script you wrote, and the film you shot, but you don't know how it's all going to come together. You just know how you want it to feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He writes "Knowing" on the diskette, and pops it into the Disclavier unit. 220

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan, Gavin and the EDITOR watch the cut.   Susan is tak notes on a legal pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan flips to her next note.   TITLES list her position

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Howard VP, Drama Development

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't know if you need the cold open. People want to get right to the story. ANGLE ON the Editor, bristling a bit. 221

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impromptu INTERVIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I invited Susan to see a rough cut because I trust her taste. INTERCUT editing suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we be more clear why Mary is so freaked out at that moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I thought it was pretty obvious. And dramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More importantly, I trust her as a barometer of Roger's taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But that's Roger's big thing this season. Never let the audience be confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Editor hands Melissa a microphone.    TITLES list her simply as: Melissa McCarthy "Mary"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're trying to squeeze in a wild line over this shot of Noelle. The monitor shows a three-second clip. It's Melissa and a eight year-old actress ("Noelle") in a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa's character looks alarmed by something the girl h just done or said. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the line? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) How could you... MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howkajew? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howkajew. It sounds like kosher drug paraphernalia. Like, come on Shmuley! Have a toke on the Howkajew. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. It's just for the test screening. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They really think people won't get it? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dumb people might not. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think we were making the show for dumb people. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa holds a microphone. As video footage plays back, we hear three evenly-spaced LOOPING BEEPS. Where the fourth one would be, Melissa say the line. MELISSA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howkajew... (again) How could you... (again) How couldjew... Finished, she hands the mic back to Gavin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how I like ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa giggles. 223-226

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MODERATOR explains how it all works to the RECRUITED AU The test begins. ANGLE ON a monitor.         We see a scene of Melissa (as a forest road. 228

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a one-way mirror, Gavin and Susan watch as the Moderator asks a group of twelve MALE VIEWERS about the p they just watched. Their comments are mostly positive. Gavin and Susan share notepad, as always. One AGITATED MAN keeps staring at the mirror, right at Ga (We recognize him as the Parole Officer from Part One.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's looking at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a test, Gavin waves his arm. The Agitated Man's expression changes slightly, but it's not clear whether i in reaction or not. The Moderator directs her next question to the Agitated M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you? Did you feel it was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show's not real. Why can't you see that? Jesus! Are you fucking blind? (looking at the mirror) You think you're above it all, don't you? You are trapped here with the rest of them, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up, pushing past the other people to come right to the one-way glass. He stares directly at Gavin, even though he shouldn't be able to see him. He SHOUTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.   Get out! Oblivio accebit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin backs away from the glass, freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impromptu INTERVIEW with Gavin, standing beside his Prius He's clearly still shaken by the experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy was crazy. Obviously. The show is kinda twisted, and it just flipped something in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin sounds like he's trying to convince himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oblivio accebit. It's Latin. "Oblivion approaches."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think it means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other than the world is coming to an end? "Oblivio" also means forgetting, forgetfulness. (jump cut) I think that's what I'm going to do. Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin hosts a game night: good friends and lots of cocktails. The guests include Melissa and Susan, along wi SAM, TOM, BRUCE, DANA, JON, KEVIN, JEFF, DAN, and CARL. ( don't show anyone's names.) They're playing Celebrity. We go several rounds, keeping

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between rounds of Celebrity, party-goers mingle. Gavin is making a new batch of cocktails -- he obviously has a kna for it. Susan pours herself another glass of chardonnay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a chance to look at the cards yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the screening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa reaches in, grabbing the vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me.      Daddy needs his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a quick Cape Cod.            From the other roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman, where's my cocktail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back) I'm a-comin! (to Gavin) I still love you most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a quick peck, then dashes off with Sam's dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing her thought) People write stuff on the cards they won't say in a focus group. They get more specific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SHAKES the mixer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger has this advice I always remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about anyone who scores you in the Twos and Threes. They'll never like your show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin pours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead, look for the Nines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're the one who think your show is almost the best thing they've ever seen. They get your vision. They just want it to be even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa YELLS from the living room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round two is starting without you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll look at the cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making his way back to the living room, he stops by the phone. Pulls out an orange Post-It and makes a note. As he leaves, we go in CLOSE to read it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes the numbers point things out that you don't want to admit to yourself. In this case, Melissa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT:   Comment cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her overall scores were okay. But if you look at the people who scored the show highest, the one consistent dip was Melissa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and Gavin are having lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have a ton to do in the pilot. There's so much to set up, you don't get a lot of Melissa- time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. That's one of the challenges with a premise pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the network still likes the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Roger is your biggest cheerleader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about above Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger calls the shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After he consults with the Higher Powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they like the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't seen it. They're watching all the pilots on Friday. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you focusing on Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's the biggest concern. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's also the biggest star in the show. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're the biggest star. Roger made a huge deal with you, and he went along with casting Melissa when that wasn't his instinct. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hooray for Roger. I don't understand what you want me to do. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet with someone. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dahlia Salem. Gavin drops his fork so that it will CLATTER on his plate SUSAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The network has a holding deal with her. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And you put her in Gatin's pilot. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead. It's dying. But the network loves Dahlia. So if she could jump over to your show... GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Replace Melissa and reshoot the pilot. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger would pay for it. Gavin is nauseous.   He has to take a drink to be able to speak. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is this even about Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about getting your show on the air. That's all that matters in the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing. 235

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin meets with Dahlia Salem. She's pretty, funny, and v They talk about the other pilot (Gatin's), the role, and double-top-secret conversations. It goes well. They seem 236

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dahlia is gone.           INTERVIEW with Gavin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see why the network loves her. It's just, I wrote the part for Melissa. She's one of my best friends. And in my head, I only see Melissa for the role. (jump cut) Could Dahlia do it? Absolutely. It could work. I just don't know if I want it to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A empty storefront in Koreatown, both walls lined with computers for the CUSTOMERS playing high-end videogames. see Gavin playing. His INTERVIEW is intercut with his intense focus on the screen as he plays "Bad Day L.A."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get stressed out, I play videogames. It's my therapy. I can't have them on my own computer, because then I'd never write. So I come down to Koreatown. (jump cut)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Videogames are better than real life. When you get stuck, you can always hit `reset.' Life needs a reset button. 239

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're really going to replace Melissa, I want to hear it from Roger. 240

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan talks to the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger's on a flight to London. But I talked with him before he left. He said yes on Dahlia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, replace Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants your show on the air, starring Dahlia. I just got off the phone with her agents. They love it. She loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to call her agents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God no.    I'll tell her. Gavin hangs up.   We stay on his side of the conversation In the background, we see the door to the driveway swing by itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat later, it SLAMS shut. Gavin is understandably startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa, wearing a nun's habit, sings "As Long As He Need Me." A PIANIST is rehearsing with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as he needs me, I know where I must be... INTERCUT with on-camera INTERVIEW:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In-between the pilot and the series, I'm trying to squeeze in a one-woman show. (edit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always been obsessed with nuns. They're sort of like God's fag-hags. Melissa spots Gavin entering and sings the rest of the so to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin and Melissa have martinis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my house is haunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your house is really old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1926. Ever since I got back, I feel like there's someone else there. And then last night, I thought I heard something. A woman singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   Like a ghost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. And then I saw something. I ran into someone. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a man. I think it was me. A beat while Melissa processes. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your house is haunted by yourself? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin, are you alright? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    No. He takes a long beat, psyching himself up.    What spills is heartfelt but clearly rehearsed. GAVIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The network wants to replace you. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm letting them, because I really want the show on the air. I have all these characters inside my head, and they want to live. I'm the only way they can. This is the only way they can. I have five seasons mapped out, and though it sucks, either you go away, or the show goes. I had to make a decision, and that's the decision I made. I'm sorry. By the end of it, we can hear the emotion in his voice. Melissa takes a beat to process. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's done. Finished.   Decided. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. It's not your fault. You're morally incapable of doing the right thing. Gavin doesn't rise to the challenge. MELISSA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong. I think you do feel bad for me. But that's all you feel for me. You still see me as the fat girl you call on Friday night when a date falls through. Let's go to a movie! Let's go to Fubar! And if you meet a hot piece of ass, don't worry about Melissa, you can apologize tomorrow. Or don't! Same difference. It's not like we're actually friends. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to do this on camera. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, because you can't control it. Your little puppets are off their strings, running around. Saying things you didn't write. Reality terrifies you. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reality. MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reality is, you would not be here without me. I gave you your first few roles. And your career is a result of that. With exaggerated relief... MELISSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, thank you. Thank you for finally playing that card. I always knew you were holding onto it, the "I invented Melissa McCarthy card." Congratulations, you win. The game is over. She gets up to go, then decides she has one more thing to say:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever pity me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves him sitting at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New MUSIC for a change of mood:     upbeat, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upfronts is the week each year when the networks present their fall schedule to advertisers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of like, "Here's our new shit. Like it?" (edit) Upfronts is a complete oxymoron, because no one is remotely honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The schedule is a secret until it's announced, so everything is still in play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But hey!   At least you're in New York!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin watches Manhattan roll by out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin tips the DRIVER and wheels his luggage into a skyscraper hotel. 249

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin opens the door to room 1909. 250

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin checks out the view.     We go CLOSE ON a card whic reads: Congrats! Love Roger, Susan, and everyone at the network It came with a fruit tray. 251

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin, alone, is headed down to the lobby.      Impromptu INTERVIEW continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's surreal being here. None of this is how I planned it. The elevator stops at another floor. CAMERA doesn't look the doors open, but Gavin spots someone he knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God.    Hi.    Gavin. TURN to find Dahlia Salem.     She's hesitant to get on t elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing your...show. She means the camera filming them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on. Come join reality television. She steps on.    Hits the button for "Lobby."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now. This whole last 24 hours has been surreal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said surreal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good? I wanted to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.   Call anytime.   I don't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just felt weird about what happened. Not sure he's following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did something happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the hotel, Gavin is on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I just bumped into Dahlia Salem, star of my show... TITLES indicate Gavin's on the phone with his agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... who tells me Gatin's show got picked up, so no, she won't be in my show, which makes me wonder, does my show even exist? As he listens to the other side, we hear a distant BOOM, then a RUSH, like autumn leaves blowing down a street. Gavin reacts, though none of the PASSERSBY seem to hear i Back to the conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've left word with Roger. I've left word with Susan. It's like they've dropped off the face of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is on her phone. At the same time, she's plowing through email on her Blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, the whole schedule's in flux. You get these missives from Roger and the Higher Powers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but you're not sure what they add up to. Right now, I can't say for certain whether Knowing will end up on the schedule at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin talks with JOHN GATINS (34), who's doing abs on an exercise ball. John Gatins Creator/Showrunner "Paradise Fields"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look,   I'm sorry. But I'm kind of not.    I want my show on the air. And I   think it was shitty for you to go   after Dahlia behind my back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard your show was gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I "heard" you fired Melissa McCarthy without having a backup. Why would they pick up your show when you don't have a star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The network wanted Dahlia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, in my show. We tested right before you. Our numbers were through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.   Who's your exec?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She would know. She was there. Ask her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is on her cell phone. A cocktail party is in full swing nearby. We can hear the DIN and MUSIC, and see the occasional GUEST looking for the restrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm   at the UTA party. Yeah. Did you   hear about Ricky's assistant? She   literally shat herself. No, I saw   it. In the background, we see Gavin approaching. Susan spots and seizes up a bit. She holds up a one-sec finger to him she continues her conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will break your fucking finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you back. She hangs up. They look each other in the eye, daring eac other to go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger wanted to talk to you personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're only picking up two dramas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest is, what, reality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go mid-season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go to Hell. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. She takes a beat, trying to size him up. SUSAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I deliberately sabotaged your show. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you? SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G., I'm on your side. Trust me, I'm the only one who is trying to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN SUSAN
dialogues.text: Protect me from what?   You?    There is so much more goi You are psychotic.              on than you... GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I want to know is why. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a motive? GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't "Crime Lab."   No one got murdered. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My show did. So tell me why. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to get you away from her. She was holding you back. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa. SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to give her up. (beat) C'mon, G. If she really mattered, you couldn't have betrayed her so easily. GAVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you're the victim? The big Creator can't stand up to one little d-girl? It was your choice. I didn't make you do anything. I mean, do you have any principles? Do you believe in anything but your own ego?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dialogue used to be sharper. Maybe Gatins could do a polish. He suddenly punches her, one hit to the face.   She drops hard. Gavin takes a step back. Tasting blood, Susan gets to her knees.   A wry smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all there is? In the background, we see partygoers responding to the bl Susan gets to her feet. She approaches Gavin, hands open. She's not going to hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel like a man? Because I'll tell you a secret. She leans in very close to his ear.   There's a strange intimacy between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not. She walks away.   CLOSE ON Gavin. 256

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move with Gavin as he walks. He's trying to get away f the camera, but it keeps following him. He reaches a crosswalk. He has to wait for the light. Finally, he looks INTO CAMERA:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't want to do this anymore. My show's not going to happen, so this show is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAVIN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Gone. I`m not going to be your fucking puppet. OFF-SCREEN VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Gavin looks left, where an African-American woman is wait for the same crosswalk. (We recognize her as Octavia, the streetwalker from Part One.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. OCTAVIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who were you talking to? Gavin looks back towards camera, a strange expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Gavin and the woman on the corner. There's no came Gavin could have been talking to. He's understandably perplexed: Where did the documentary crew go? Was there ever anyone there? Our CAMERA style has changed:    instead of handheld and we're smooth and slow. The MUSIC has completely changed, underscoring a sense of creeping dread. We HOLD for a long beat. The light changes. Still a littl unnerved, Octavia begins to cross the street. Only then do we notice something unusual floating above h head: A SPHERE OF BLUE LIGHT. WIDER, we see that everyone on the street has the same ki of sphere floating a foot above their heads. No one seems see the lights other than Gavin. Gavin looks around in uneasy fascination, as if he's just landed on an alien world. A beat, then he has an unsettling thought. He slowly looks up. Above his own head, he sees the same sphere of light -- only his is bright white. Pulsing. Blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK, RISING UP to a perspective above and behind Gavin. As we do, the edges of the frame creep in, reveali ICONS and unintelligible STATISTICS, changing moment by moment. A dialog box appears in the center of the screen, reading Exit Now? Unsaved changes will be lost. [ Cancel ]          [ Exit ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arrow slides back and forth between to the two options Finally it lands on `Exit.' A CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're continuing an earlier scene from the end of Part On

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand why you're a little confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I'm a lot confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theories?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm dead. This is Hell, or Purgatorium or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, a purgatorium is where Romans vomited. But no. This is as real as anything can be. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) What does that mean? She sits forward in her chair.   By instinct, he sits bac MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is what it is. But you're not who you think you are. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Who am I? With practiced calm... MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a multi-dimensional being of vast, almost infinite power. You created this world on a whim, and decided to stick around to see how it turned out. You, this body you're in, is just one of your incarnations. Avatars. Call you what you will. Not sure he follows... GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying I'm God? MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically, no. If God is a ten -- a theoretical ultimate, that-which- no-greater-can-be-imagined -- you're more of a nine. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you? MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humans are sevens. Monkeys are sixes. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the eights? MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Koalas. They're telepathic.    Plus, they control the weather. She didn't mean to get on that tangent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGARET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's important is that you, you're the big cheese. El Supremo. You could destroy the world with a single thought. (suddenly) Don't, incidentally. Just file that away. But the truth is, you hold all the cards: every church, every candle, every sacrifice -- that's for you. When people pray, they're not praying because they want this thing or that thing. They just don't want to be forgotten. MARGARET (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you understand, I would have told you earlier, but I didn't... GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. MARGARET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. GARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. But I don't believe you. He gets up to exit. (This is where we jump-cut time earli FREEZE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: Part Three:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a WIDE SHOT, we see a vast field, bordered by green mountains. Unseen BIRDS call out from the trees, while insects CLICK and WHIRR. In the distance, we spot swatches of bright colors moving way. It's a family: father GABRIEL (34), wife MARY (33) a daughter NOELLE (8). They're returning from a short day hike. Mary carries a small videocamera. Seeing that Noelle is already a ways down the path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noelle!   Don't get too far ahead. Noelle turns around. Instead of speaking, she moves her hands in sign language. (She's mute, not deaf.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   You had ice cream at lunch. Noelle begs to differ.   More signing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently frozen yogurt doesn't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make note. 302

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family walks up to their car, a blue Toyota Prius. Gabriel sheds his daypack, trying to open the hatchback. won't lift. Mary goes to open the passenger door.      Locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hit it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fishes the keys out of his pocket.     Presses the rem entry button repeatedly. Gabriel tries to open the driver's side door.      Locked Noelle knows something's wrong. Gabriel pulls the small mechanical key out of the fob. Unlocks the door and climbs in. Opens the door for Mary a Noelle. GABRIEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we left the overhead light on. He taps it.   Moves the switch. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Noelle signs her made-up representation of "shit." MARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noelle. Gabriel slides the key into the slot.     Hits "START." Nothing. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battery is dead. Least the starter is. Noelle leans forward, aware that this is something seriou MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we...? GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We call the service.     That's all we can do. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the little battery that's dead, right? The big one is probably fine. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't jump it from one battery to the other? Cross-over somehow? GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you marry?      MacGyver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out of the car, retrieving his cell phone. Mary follows him out. Noticing that he's not dialing... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you getting a signal? GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Do you? She checks her phone.    A long beat. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!     One bar. They're both relieved. Finding the AAA card in his wallet Gabriel takes the phone and dials. It's at this moment we notice the familiar green string bracelet around Gabriel's wrist. In the back seat, Noelle KNOCKS on the window.   She sign asking if everything is okay. MARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay. Daddy's calling people to help us. Gabriel pulls the phone from his ear.   Looks at the scre Hits redial. Fuck. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minute you try to place a call, the bar goes away. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep trying. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll keep trying, Mary.   But it will keep happening. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you want to do? GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He tries redial. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you hold it up higher. Humoring her, he holds it at arm's length.   No good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is we're boxed in. It's a canyon. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we turned off the main road, it was more open. And higher, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's at least a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can run that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...we stay here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we have a choice, so, yeah. Go. Half a beat, while each waits for the other to think of a better plan. Neither does. Gabriel leans down next to Noelle's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's going to get a truck to help us out. You take care of your mom, okay? Noelle nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back. Gabriel gives Mary a quick peck and starts running down t road. We MOVE IN on Noelle, who smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravel CRUNCHES under Gabriel's shoes as he runs.    He k an easy pace. In VARIOUS SHOTS, we get a sense of the distance he's travelling. He passes gulches, meadows and boulder fields

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally arrives at the junction of the dirt road and a larger... 304

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling out Mary's cell phone, Gabriel tries to get a sig By his reaction, it's still iffy. He dials, but the call drops.    Tries again.   Just the He looks left.   Looks right.    Looks back down the dirt He decides to head off to the right, downhill. 305

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch up to Gabriel as he's walking in the middle of t road, still trying unsuccessfully to get a signal. In the distance, he spots a patch of moving color: a fema hiker. A moment's hesitation, then he YELLS out to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me!     Hi! Hello? She stops, turns. Gabriel jogs to close the distance. As we approach, we reveal SIERRA, 38. In the past 10 years, she's "made a fr start" 12 times. In this incarnation, she's a wilderness- loving, Bush-hating, wildly-overeducated clerk at Trader Joe's in Venice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.     Do you have a cell phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't. There's no service up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm finding that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can usually get a signal up at the ranger station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... She points in the opposite direction -- back the way he c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIERRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You follow the road. It's probably... I don't know. You have a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dead.     That's why I need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... She pulls a stray hair back from her mouth.       Notices noticing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. A beat.   She takes a subtle step closer to the center of road. GABRIEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you headed back to your car now? If you could give me a ride to a gas station, wherever... She doesn't leap to extend an invitation.        It takes for Gabriel to figure out why. GABRIEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. Look, I'm not some crazy Ted Bundy guy. I'm not going to rape you or kill you or anything. She doesn't seem reassured. GABRIEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, that's what Ted Bundy would say. Look, I'm a videogame designer. (fishing through wallet) My wife is an editor. My daughter is four. He offers her a family photo.     She looks at it, but do take it. GABRIEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waiting back at the car, and I want to get some help before it gets dark. SIERRA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can call somebody when I get to town. Trying to temper his frustration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. I do. But you don't know where the car is. And the guy might not come. We can't be up here all night. Sierra backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sorry. Just help me out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I can't. I'm sorry. Once she feels she's reached a good distance, she turns a keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you trust me? She doesn't turn back, heading down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is sitting in the back seat of the Prius with Noelle who's getting tired of her coloring book. Noelle signs something to Mary, who considers the request

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but you have to be careful, understand? You have to use Big Girl hands. Noelle nods. Mary hands her the small video camera. Noell has some trouble folding out the little screen, but eventually gets it open without any help from her mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to see where we were today? Noelle nods. Mary takes the camera back for a second, flipping it to playback mode and rewinding. The blocky video footage zip past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now hit play. This button. Noelle does. On the tiny screen, we see Noelle and her father eating lunch by a waterfall. (Mary is filming.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's you. And there's Daddy. You're a little movie star, huh? Noelle smiles.   Signs something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be back soon. Don't you worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel continues walking, headed back in the direction h came. From behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He turns, finding her a ways back.   She approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I was sure you weren't following me. I'm sorry, it's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought I was Ted Bundy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Gabriel.   Bundy. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sierra. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird that there's no cars.    At all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, listen. I'm parked that way. She points off the road, through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that far. If you want, I'll give you a ride to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Make up some karma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lead the way. She does. They cross off the pavement, descending into a dark forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel walks with Sierra. The trees here are taller, creating a cathedral-like ceiling above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, confession.    I kind of recognized you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure, but I think I saw a picture of you in some videogame magazine my boyfriend had. You're, like, the shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like the Quentin Tarantino of that world. A videogame God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: You seriously recognized me off of one photo?

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: I thought you were kinda hot. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Considering..?

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Within the subset of videogame people.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: I wasn't masturbating to your picture or anything.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I'm flattered.

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: You should be. I'm stingy with compliments.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: So your boyfriend plays videogames?

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Ex-boyfriend. And yes. Way too many. He used to play Evercrack back in the day, but yours, well, that was like...what's worse than crack?

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Super-crack?

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Sure.   He was this orc witch doctor guy.

dialogues.speaker: GABRIEL
dialogues.text: Shaman?

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Yeah. At one point he was spending like, 40 hours a week gathering "thunderleaf" or whatever. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I was his mule, hauling it around because he ran out of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had an account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was part of your world, and you didn't even know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make it up to me. 309

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is pacing -- but trying not to look like she's pacin She holds the other cell phone (Gabriel's), which she tur on and off, hoping that somehow she'll get a signal. Each time she turns it on, we hear the CHIMES.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PRIUS
dialogues.text: Noelle is still playing with the video camera, watching footage of the hike. She decides to wind back further. CLOSE ON the blocky pixels rushing past. Noelle hits "play."   For now, we just hear the audio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I have five seasons mapped out, and though it sucks, either you go away, or the show goes. I had to make a decision, and that's the decision I made. I'm sorry. We reveal the screen. We're watching the argument between Gavin and Melissa from Part 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's done. Finished. Decided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Confused, Noelle looks out at her mother, Mary, who is st pacing with the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. It's not your fault. You're morally incapable of doing the right thing. Noelle REWINDS further.    Blocky pixels RUSH PAST as we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sierra continues to lead the way. She seems confident whe she's headed, even though there's no real path. During the conversation, we notice a small tattoo on her right shoulder blade: IX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you play a lot of characters at once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple.    Most people do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not most people. You created the world. You know all the secret codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, like `God mode'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when you have all the powers, and you can't be killed. It's fine when you're designing, but it's really boring to play. A game isn't fun unless there are rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you make the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. I mean, you want to give everyone freedom, but they can't handle it. Half your players are teenage boys, and it's like they're programmed to be destructive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They deliberately crash the world servers. They'd ruin everything just to prove they could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah offers Gary her water bottle, which he gladly takes Out of nowhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm pretty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, turning to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm hot?   On a purely physical level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a rave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know why you're asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ex-boyfriend, the orc, he says, "What I like about you is that you're not so hot that I'm afraid of losing you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the orc now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. I spiked his water bottle with a massive quantity of GHB. He hallucinated, went into convulsions and died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He screws the cap back on the water bottle and hands it b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me not to piss you off, Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sierra. He's surprised.    He could have sworn her name was Sarah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what makes you think you haven't pissed me off already? She smiles, keeps walking. 311

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary sits down in the front passenger seat of the car. Noelle is still in back, watching footage on the video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing, kiddo? Noelle doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking we could all go to El Cholo for dinner. How would you feel about some blue corn enchiladas? Should we ask Daddy when he gets back? Without looking up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming back. Mary is stunned. For her part, Noelle seems to have no id she just spoke her first words. We hear three evenly-spaced BEEPS.    After the third one says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you... Mary flinches.    It's like someone walked over her grave Noelle hands her the camera. The footage is cued to earli in Part 2, where Gavin is having Melissa loop in a wild l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howkajew. How could you. How could you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how I like ya. Mary backs out of the car, as if trying to get away from video camera. But she's still holding it. She hits STOP.   Tries to collect herself. Noelle gets out of the car, but doesn't approach.      Sh "Mommy?" Mary backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Sierra stop for a moment, so he can pull off outer shirt. For the first time, we see that Gabriel has large tattoo on his back which looks like this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sweating a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I crazy, or is it getting hotter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're crazy. She hands him back the water bottle.   He gladly drinks. When she takes the bottle back, she steps forward. The motion leaves them face-to-face. She pauses for a moment, just long enough for him to turn away. He doesn't. She kisses him. He doesn't really kiss back -- but he doesn't fight it, either. She puts a hand on his thigh, sliding up the inside. when she reaches his crotch does he pull back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a wife. And a daughter. They're waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, which direction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back... Gabriel turns, trying to get his bearing.      The trees He nearly falls over. He manages to steady himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face it, G.: You don't know where they are. You don't know where you are. We've been walking in circles for an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no car. That was all a... (what's the word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "pretense," I guess. An excuse to get you alone. Wobbling, Gabriel sits down on a stump.   Sierra kneels d in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dizzy, huh? It's probably just the GHB. In the water. She holds up the water bottle.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACKS FROM PARTS ONE AND TWO
Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel experienced the flashbacks.   He felt time move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
