dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry it had to come this, G. But it'll all be over soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No. This isn't a murder. It's an intervention.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK SEQUENCE.
dialogues.text: Images to accompany previous dialogue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to get you away from her. She was holding you back. You had to give her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can you out of here.    But you have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel like a man?   You're not. 315

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel dry-heaves.   Sierra rubs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Just let it go.       Let it go. She's genuinely empathetic -- she doesn't enjoy his suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did it to yourself.   Admitting that is the first step. She comes around to face him. And now we see they're not alone. Two other familiar faces approach: THE PAROLE OFFICER/AGITATED MAN, and OCTAVIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Nines as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a crack-head, G. The thing is, this planet, these people, they're your drug of choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The next sequence bridges multiple earlier scenes from P One and Two. Gary/Gavin/Gabriel has one conversation with Sarah/Susan/Sierra, but it's broken up among previous sce and locations, sometimes for just a line.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that hard to make a universe. At first, you just checked in every once in a while. See how the Neanderthals were doing. Move some continents around. But then you got more into it. Starting playing a couple of characters of your own. Kings. Slaves. Messiahs. Pretty soon, you were playing 24/7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have I..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been gone for four thousand years. Not that time means the same for us, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came looking for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what a girl does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why now? x107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streetwalker Octavia leans in Gary's car window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you forgot who you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agitated Man leans up to the one-way glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forgot this wasn't real. 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't just storm in on a fiery chariot. It's your universe. We had to play by your rules. We had to make you see how limited and corrupt your little world was. Don't get me wrong, this world is nice. It's cozy. But do you remember where you came from? A few beats while it comes back to him. Tears start to bu in his eyes. What he's picturing is unspeakably beautiful

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was warm. And white.    Like... x160

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agitated Man/Parole Officer attaches Gary's anklet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't describe it with human words. x108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Octavia leans over Gary, who has fallen off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't think it with human thoughts. 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you have to come back. Come back with us. With me. x256

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is sitting on the road. Noelle has her chin on her mother's shoulder, watching the videotape with her. ON SCREEN, with tinny audio: (from scene 177)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could destroy the world with a single thought. (suddenly) Don't, incidentally. Just file that away. But the truth is, you hold all the cards: every church, every candle, every sacrifice -- that's for you. When people pray, they're not praying because they want this thing or that thing. They just don't want to be forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is still watching the tape. She realizes Noelle isn' watching over her shoulder anymore. Mary looks around.    Her daughter is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noelle?    Noelle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel and Sierra are back at the junction where the pav road meets the gravel road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if I just cut back, didn't get so involved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both know that'll never work. Next week, you'll be back here redesigning the pinecones. You have to quit cold-turkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can. But I can't force you to leave. You have to want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand, running a finger through the green st bracelet around his wrist. She kisses him.   And then she's gone. Gabriel stands there for a long beat, considering his decision. x103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicking, Mary calls out for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noelle!   Noelle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nowhere to be found.     Then, from behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel is walking up the gravel road, with Noelle holdin his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't forget you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary regards him as a familiar stranger, a beloved impost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC BEGINS, a song that will carry us through the next sequence. 319

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel climbs into the driver's seat. Both Mary and Noel watch with interest as he pushes the "START" button. The BEEPS and engages without any problem. Everyone fastens their seatbelts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prius drives down the gravel road. Mary tries to keep her eyes on the scenery, but they keep drifting over to Gabriel, trying to read what he's thinking. 321

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prius turns on to the paved road.   Headlights switch 322

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The metal gate at the top of the driveway swings open, SQUEALING on its rusty hinges. 326

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel lifts the sleeping Noelle out of the car. Carries her into the house. Mary shuts the door behind them. 327

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking off her shoes, Gabriel tucks Noelle into bed.   Tu on a nightlight for her. 328

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel brushes his teeth with an electric toothbrush whi Mary reads a magazine on the toilet. 329

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel switches off the light. He spoons Mary, who kisse his hand. On both Mary and Gabriel's faces, we see anxiet Things left unsaid. 330

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel lies awake, staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel's bare feet walk down the carpeted stairs. 332

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stares at the three paintings on the wall. 333

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stands in the doorway, looking out at the inky-bl sky. His eyes are red, tired. He hasn't slept at all. It's very quiet, except for the occasional precocious BIR CALL. Mary enters from the living room, still in her pajamas. knows she's there. Neither wants to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to go, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I can stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? Forever? Every day, you'd know what you were missing. He smiles, a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens? If you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worst-case scenario? Spontaneous disintegration into a fiery void. Oblivio accebit. The end of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all? Both smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That probably wouldn't happen. The basic structure of the universe should hold. I guess I'm just worried about the human factor. You guys kill each other a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fairness, that's usually in your name. Plus we've gotten much more efficient at it. A beat. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this world. I like my life, here, with you and Noelle... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not real. I'm not really your wife, you're not really my husband. On some level, it's all pretend. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not pretend. There's a reason you were there, in every version. You were my sister, my wife, my best friend... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a little creepy. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you close. In one version, I even told you. I warned you that some day they might come for me, and... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You'd have to leave.   How many versions were there? GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety.   This is the last one. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've destroyed billions of people with a thought. Obliterated them. And you'd like to think it's painless... MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. You don't have to explain, or apologize. Everything that is, is because of you. If that's all, that's enough. With that, there's really nothing more to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you don't really need to pack anything. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're great. It's been a pleasure. GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise.    I love you. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you, too. Ya big lug. He kisses her. It's not a big, passionate, movie-ending kiss, but rather a fond kiss farewell. At the end of it, WHISPERS into her ear: GABRIEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my favorite. She smiles. With two fingers, Gabriel BREAKS the green string bracele around his left wrist. And in that moment, a film passes over him, like the boun between water and air. He's stepped out of this dimension. Mary is frozen with the same smile on her face, but we no that she and the kitchen around her have flattened out to dimensional images. She and everything around her has become like wallpaper, slowly curling away, revealing emptiness beneath. Gabriel collapses into a single, spiky sphere of light. The light moves through the kitchen, creating waves that ripple through the tissue-thin walls. Picking up speed, the sphere rushes through the window, heading west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light flies out over Hancock Park, the mansions an skyscrapers seem unreal, like models. Reaching Santa Monica, we pass over the ferris wheel at t end of the pier. We dive into the blue ocean beneath us, which becomes onl swirling gray fog with a viscous thickness. We see three lights in the distance.    We join them, mov with them. Further ahead, more lights, circling. It's a loose spiral made of stars, resembling nothing so much as the number 9 As we get closer and closer, we...

dialogues.speaker: A PALE EYE,
dialogues.text: opening.    We are... 335

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands reach up, expecting to find glasses, but there are none. As we PULL OUT, we reveal it's not Mary, Melissa or Marga but a fourth person -- just slightly different from any o them. We'll call her M. She looks first to the spot where Gabriel was standing. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, do we have nutmeg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M looks over at husband Ben, who is busy making pancakes, reading from a recipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming around from behind Ben, Noelle checks through the spice drawer. M watches her with cautious fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnamon, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M catches her reflection in the toaster.   Notices she lo different than she expected. NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ben) If I had a horse... Noelle turns back with the spices, handing them to Ben on a time. NOELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would name her Cinnamon. BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I had another horse... BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nutmeg? NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Flash. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie? She beckons Noelle over. Tucks back the little girl's hai Keeping her voice low enough so Ben can't hear: M  (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to sound really strange, but...what's my name? Noelle only gives her a half-crazy look. NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmmmmmm-Mommy. Noelle smiles.   M smiles too, a little embarrassed. M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.    Exactly. Noelle looks her right in the eye. NOELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming back. But it's gonna be okay. He put the pieces together, it's like... M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best of all possible worlds. Noelle taps her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey? Is it supposed to stick like this? Sharing a look... M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should help him. Noelle agrees.   They head over to assist. We MOVE ACROSS the family as they work on the pancakes, Noelle directing how big the ears on hers should be. We leave them in the middle of a messy kitchen, gooey pancakes, and a good life. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: ADDITIONAL MATERIAL
dialogues.text: The following scene (Scene 99) is the conversation betwee and G that plays near the end of Part Three. The plan is shoot this scene in almost every setup of the film that involves both characters -- be it in Part One, Two or Thr So we'll be shooting this scene a lot. We'll then be intercutting the best of all these moments to create one sequence. 99

Don't get me wrong, this world is nice. It's cozy. But do you remember where you came from? A few beats while it comes back to him. Tears start to bu in his eyes. What he's picturing is unspeakably beautiful

dialogues.speaker: G.
dialogues.text: It was warm. And white.   Like... S. You can't describe it with human words. You can't think it with human thoughts. (beat) That's why you have to come back. Come back with us. With me.
